intro: Pulmonaria pubescens, commonly known as the downy lungwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, velvety foliage. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to white, typically blooming in early spring. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its common name. Pulmonaria pubescens thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland settings.
